intro: Biscutella peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian biscuitroot, is a perennial herb native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its root system is notable for its thick, fleshy roots, which are sometimes used in traditional medicine. Biscutella peruviana thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cooler, temperate climates.
